n  terms  of  P1,  the  above  lot  has  been  se(cid:425)led  in  favour  of  Wa(cid:425)a  Kankanamlage  Podi
Appuhamy, and not in the name of Wa(cid:425)ewa Kankanamlage Podi Appuhamy, which the 1st
Defendant claims is the name of their father. The Plain(cid:415)ﬀ however claims that their father
was also known by the name, Wa(cid:425)a Kankanamlage Podi Appuhamy. Whether Wa(cid:425)ewa
Kankanamlage Podi Appuhamy and Wa(cid:425)a Kankanamlage Podi Appuhamy are one and the
same person is one of the principal issues in this case, for the aforemen(cid:415)oned reason that
while the Se(cid:425)lement Order P1 published in 1996 carries the name Wa(cid:425)a Kankanamlage
Podi Appuhamy, all other documents including the death  cer(cid:415)ﬁcate of Podi Appuhamy
refers to him as Wa(cid:425)ewa Kankanamlage Podi Appuhamy.
